intro: Psychotria jinotegensis var. jinotegensis, commonly known as the Jinotega Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the humid lowland forests of Nicaragua. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often found in shaded understory environments and is adapted to thrive in high humidity and moderate light conditions.
